metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2187 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The gtco_probe function in drivers/input/tablet/gtco.c in the Linux kernelthrough 4.5.2 allows physically proximate attackers to cause a denial ofservice (NULL pointer dereference and system crash) via a crafted endpointsvalue in a USB device descriptor.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2187` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-87-generic - 3.13.0-87.133
linux-image-3.13.0-87-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-87.133
linux-image-3.13.0-87-lowlatency - 3.13.0-87.133

linux-image-3.13.0-87-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-87.133
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-87-generic - 3.13.0-87.133
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-87.133').
